content.text:
<task>
[Memory Bank: Active] Subtask: Implement targeted recovery to restore host access to service UIs and validate VPN + GPU fallback. Prior diagnostics indicate:
- Root cause: rootless port-forwarding not applied (no host listeners despite published ports) under netavark/pasta on network core_default.
- Gluetun unstable; currently not running; qBittorrent depends on it (network_mode container:gluetun).
- Jellyfin stuck in Created due to missing NVIDIA lib; GPU fallback should be handled by [scripts/podman-up.sh](scripts/podman-up.sh:1) per docs [docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md](docs/GPU-TIMING-FIX.md:1).
- Compose and script SSoT: [core/podman-compose.yml](core/podman-compose.yml:1) with no-GPU fallback variant [core/podman-compose-no-gpu.yml](core/podman-compose-no-gpu.yml:1).

Strict scope
- You ARE allowed to stop and start the stack and remove/recreate the compose network.
- Do not edit files or envs in this pass (no core/.env changes).
- No sudo; rootless context only.
- Run commands from repo root /home/haint/media-stack. Collect outputs verbatim and then analyze.

Plan
1) Cleanly bring stack down, force-recreate compose network to reinitialize rootless port-forwarding.
2) Bring stack up via the wrapper to trigger GPU fallback automatically if needed.
3) Verify host listeners and HTTP reachability.
4) Verify Gluetun health and outbound connectivity.
5) Verify Jellyfin starts (or that the script correctly fell back to no-GPU).
6) Summarize results and remaining issues.

Commands to run (in order)
A) Stop and remove stack/network
./scripts/podman-down.sh
podman network rm core_default || true

B) Start stack with wrapper (handles GPU fallback)
./scripts/podman-up.sh
sleep 8

C) Confirm container states and published ports
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml ps
podman ps --format {{.Names}}\t{{.Status}}\t{{.Ports}}

D) Confirm host listeners and HTTP reachability
ss -tulpn | grep -E ":(8096|8989|7878|9696|8080)\\b" || true
for p in 8096 8989 7878 9696 8080; do echo PORT=$p; curl -fsS -m 3 -o /dev/null -w "HTTP=%{http_code}\n" http://127.0.0.1:$p || echo "CONNECT_FAIL"; done

E) Validate Gluetun health and outbound
podman inspect gluetun --format '{{.State.Status}} {{if .State.Health}}{{.State.Health.Status}}{{end}}'
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml logs --no-color --tail 120 gluetun
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml exec gluetun sh -lc 'wget -qO- https://ipinfo.io || echo FETCH_FAIL'

F) Jellyfin status (ensure GPU fallback worked)
podman inspect jellyfin --format '{{.State.Status}} {{.State.Error}} {{.State.ExitCode}}'
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml logs --no-color --tail 80 jellyfin || true

G) Compose-level port resolution (sanity)
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml port sonarr 8989 || true
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml port radarr 7878 || true
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml port prowlarr 9696 || true
podman-compose -f core/podman-compose.yml port gluetun 8080 || true

Return in attempt_completion
1) Paste raw outputs for Aâ€“G, labeled.
2) State whether host listeners appeared and which ports are now HTTP-OK.
3) Gluetun: running/healthy status and ipinfo result.
4) Jellyfin: started vs created; if created, whether logs indicate GPU lib error or wrapper fallback.
5) Final classification:
   - Fixed: port-forwarding restored (rootless netavark/pasta refreshed)
   - If still broken: note precise failure point (no listeners after up, gluetun still flapping, etc.)
6) If still broken, STOP without changes. We will follow up with a code-mode subtask to optionally add an IPv6-disable env to [core/.env](core/.env:1) for Gluetun and/or adjust networking.

These instructions supersede any conflicting general instructions. Signal completion by using attempt_completion with outputs and analysis.
</task>

reasoning_details.summary:
## Investigating Startup Issue  
- The startup failed due to a missing NVIDIA library required for Jellyfin.
- The script identified GPU devices, but the NVIDIA lib issue prevented proper initialization.

## Evaluating Fallback Mechanism  
- The wrapper was supposed to manage GPU fallback, but it didn't activate as expected.
